trans-unit.source: Declare that a website's HTTPS certificate should only be treated as valid if the public key is contained in a specified list to prevent MITM attacks that use valid CA-issued certificates.
Declare that browsers should transparently upgrade HTTP resources on a website to HTTPS.
Declares a constant with block level scope
Declares a lower bound on the number of characters a user can input.
Declares a variable with block level scope
Declares an upper bound on the number of characters the user can input. Normally the UI ignores attempts by the user to type in additional characters beyond this limit.
Decoder in JS
Deferred scripts may run after DOMContentLoaded - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=688580
Defines Accelerometer, LinearAccelerationSensor and GravitySensor interfaces for obtaining information about acceleration applied to the X, Y and Z axis of a device that hosts the sensor.
Defines a base orientation sensor interface and concrete sensor subclasses to monitor the device’s physical orientation in relation to a stationary three dimensional Cartesian coordinate system.
Defines a concrete sensor interface to measure magnetic field in the X, Y and Z axis.
Defines a concrete sensor interface to monitor the ambient light level or illuminance of the device’s environment.
Defines a concrete sensor interface to monitor the rate of rotation around the device’s local three primary axes.
Defines events that provide information about the distance between a device and an object, as measured by a proximity sensor.

Deprecated mechanism for listening to changes made to the DOM, replaced by Mutation Observers.

Desktop Firefox responds to the status of its "Work Offline" mode. If not in that mode, navigator.onLine is always true, regardless of the actual network connectivity status. See bug for details.

Disabled by default behind the javascript.options.streams and dom.streams.enabled flags.
Disabled by default behind the network.preload flag.
Disabled by default for privacy reasons. Can be enabled via the browser.send_pings flag.
Disabled by default, can be enabled using preference layout.css.font-features.enabled - defaulting to true on Nightly and Aurora only.
Disabled for Firefox 52 ESR
Disabled on Firefox ESR, but can be re-enabled with the dom.serviceWorkers.enabled and dom.push.enabled flags
Disabled on Firefox ESR, but can be re-enabled with the dom.serviceWorkers.enabled flag

Do not appear to support sticky table headers
Document Object Model Range
Document.execCommand()
Does not allow any files to be picked at all
Does not appear to have a way to print web pages
Does not appear to support the keypress event at all
Does not appear to work on Firefox mobile, despite recognition of the property.
Does not have FileReader support.
Does not have support for classList on SVG or MathML elements.
Does not include increment/decrement buttons, but does supports increment/decrement via arrow up & down keys.
Does not match <input type="checkbox" checked> or <input type="radio" checked>
Does not match non-required <select>s
Does not match the default submit button of a form
Does not provide an email-specific keyboard for email addresses
Does not support ValidityState.tooLong. In some cases, this is because .validity is not supported in the first place.
Does not support DOMAttrModified
Does not support DOMNodeInsertedIntoDocument & DOMNodeRemovedFromDocument

Does not support ValidityState.tooLong correctly in the (unlikely) case of the value being initially set too long, then changed by the user to a still incorrect state. See Firefox bug and MS Edge bug.
Does not support avoid for page-break-before & page-break-after (only page-break-inside).
Does not support background-size values in the background shorthand
Does not support fixed, and due to a bug only supports local if a border-radius is set on the element.
Does not support format('truetype-variations'), format('woff-variations'), format('woff2-variations')
Does not support fromMatrix(), fromFloat32Array(), fromFloat64Array(), and toJSON() methods
Does not support outline-offset.
Does not support overscroll-behavior: none; on the body element to prevent the overscroll glow and rubberbanding effects.
Does not support parseInt() ignoring leading zeros.
Does not support readAsBinaryString, but readAsBinaryStringcan be polyfilled
Does not support reportValidity
Does not support toDataURL()
Does not support validity.badInput
Does not support validity.tooShort. See also support for minlength.
Does not support CORS for <video> in <canvas>: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=135379
Does not support CORS for images in <canvas>
Does not support CORS for resources which redirect: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1346749
Does not support CSS transforms on SVG elements (transform attribute can be used instead)
Does not support Document.importNode on templates, nested templates or elements that contain templates.
Does not support Node.cloneNode on templates, nested templates or elements that contain templates.
Does not support OpenType-CFF2 fonts
Does not support Strict mode
Does not support assign to classList
Does not support capture from <video>/<audio>
Does not support flex-wrap, flex-flow or align-content properties
Does not support multiple parameters for the add() & remove() methods
Does not support nested media queries
Does not support the ClipboardEvent constructor
Does not support the File constructor
Does not support the HTMLTextAreaElement.maxLength DOM property.
Does not support the addPath() method
Does not support the clip value
Does not support the flex-basis property. See specs, Blink bug, Firefox bug.
Does not support the font-weight and font-stretch properties.
Does not support the nomodule attribute
Does not support the selectstart event
Does not support the size property
Does not support the steps(), step-start & step-end timing functions
Does not support the second parameter for the toggle method
Does not support the two value overflow shorthand
Does not support zero-width chars in identifiers & Immutable undefined
Does not use a special search-specific UI for the field, just the same UI as a regular <input type="text">.
Does not use favicons at all
Does not use favicons at all (but may have alternative for bookmarks, etc.).
Does not work in IE11 on select elements if only a parent has the property set (though it does work if the select element has it set explicitly)
Does not work in IE8 and IE9 on <input type="text">
Does not work in standalone running ("installed") PWAs, getUserMedia returns no video input devices in UIWebView or WKWebView, but only directly in Safari.
Does not work on select elements in Chrome and IE, only Firefox.
Does not work on links in IE11 and Edge unless display is set to block or inline-block, or position is set to absolute or fixed.
Does not yet appear in any W3C specification. Was briefly included in a spec as the "text-outline" property, but this was removed.
Doesn't fire an input event when (un)checking a checkbox or radio button, or when changing the selected file(s) of an <input type="file">. See Chrome bug, WebKit bug, and Firefox bug.
Doesn't fire an input event when (un)checking a checkbox or radio button. See MS Edge bug.
Doesn't fire an input event when deleting text (via Backspace, Delete, Cut, etc.).
Doesn't fire an input event when drag-and-dropping text into an <input> or <textarea>.
Doesn't match indeterminate <progress> bars
Doesn't match radio buttons whose radio button group lacks a checked radio button
Doesn't support the <progress> element
Dotted and dashed rounded border corners are rendered as solid in Firefox. see bug
Dotted and dashed rounded border corners are rendered as solid in Firefox. Fixed since Firefox 50. see bug
Download attribute
Drag and Drop
Due to compatibility issues, MediaSource Extensions are currently disabled by default in Samsung Internet.
Due to its wider support, consider using window.matchMedia('print') where possible.
Due to the way browsers handle sub-pixel rounding differently, layouts using calc() expressions may have unexpected results.

ES6 Generators are special functions that can be used to control the iteration behavior of a loop. Generators are defined using a function* declaration.

ES6 classes are syntactical sugar to provide a much simpler and clearer syntax to create objects and deal with inheritance.

Easy URL manipulation with URLSearchParams

Edge 13 used an earlier draft syntax. As of Edge 14 the implementation is prefixed and based on the FIDO 2.0 Web APIs.

Enabled behind the WebVR & "Gamepad Extensions" flags under chrome://flags. Currently builds use an older version of the (still changing) specification and supports only the Oculus Rift and the HTC vive on Windows VR-ready computers.
Enabled by default for Nightly and Dev Edition
Enabled by default in Nightly, but "dom.payments.request.supportedRegions" pref in "about:config" must be set to "US,CA".
Enabled in Chrome & Opera through the "experimental Web Platform features" flag
Enabled in Chrome through the "experimental Web Platform features" flag in chrome://flags
Enabled in Edge through the "Enable Unprefixed CSS Grid Layout" flag in about:flags
Enabled in Firefox by setting the about:config preference dom.IntersectionObserver.enabled to true
Enabled in Firefox by setting the about:config preference dom.image.picture.enable to true
Enabled in Firefox through the dom.details_element.enabled flag
Enabled in Firefox through the layout.css.grid.enabled flag
Enabled in Firefox through the about:config setting "layout.css.scoped-style.enabled"
Enabled in Opera through the "experimental Web Platform features" flag in opera://flags
Enabled on the regular version of Firefox 53, but not the ESR version.
Enabled since 27 May 2016
Enabled through the "Enable Experimental Web Platform Features" flag in chrome://flags
Enabled through the "Enable Experimental Web Platform Features" flag in opera://flags
Enabled through the "Enable HTML Imports" flag in chrome://flags
Enabled through the "Enable HTML Imports" flag in opera://flags
Enabled through the "Experimental Web Platform features" flag in chrome://flags
Enabled through the "Experimental Web Platform features" flag in opera://flags
Enabled through the "Experimental Web Platform features" flag in chrome://flags
Enabled through the "Experimental Web Platform features" flag in opera://flags
Enabled through the "dom.webcomponents.customelements.enabled" preference in about:config
Enabled through the "dom.webcomponents.enabled" or "dom.webcomponents.customelements.enabled" preference in about:config
Enabled through the "dom.webcomponents.enabled" preference in about:config
Enabled through the "dom.webcomponents.shadowdom.enabled" preference in about:config
Enabled through the "experimental Web Platform features" flag
Enabled through the "experimental Web Platform features" flag in chrome://flags
Enabled via the "Experimental Web Platform features" flag

Ensure new browsing contexts are opened without a useful window.opener
Environment Variables env()

Event listeners created with the passive: true option cannot cancel (preventDefault()) the events they receive. Primarily intended to be used with touch events and wheel events. Since they cannot prevent scrolls, passive event listeners allow the browser to perform optimizations that result in smoother scrolling.
Event triggered in JavaScript when the URL's hash has changed (for example: page.html#foo to page.html#bar)
EventListener polyfill which includes a CustomEvent polyfill
EventTarget.addEventListener()
EventTarget.dispatchEvent
Events to indicate when the user's connected (online and offline events) and the navigator.onLine property to see current status.

Excludes punctuation immediately after the first letter from the match. (The spec says it should be included in the match.)
Exclusions Level 1
Exclusions defines how inline content flows around elements. It extends the content wrapping ability of floats to any block-level element.
Existing properties of the returned object are immutable.
Expanded form options, including things like date pickers, sliders, validation, placeholders and multiple file uploads. Previously known as "Web forms 2.0".

Extensions to the Number built-in object in ES6, including constant properties EPSILON, MIN_SAFE_INTEGER, and MAX_SAFE_INTEGER, and methods isFinite, isInteger, isSafeInteger, and isNaN.

File inputs that are descendants of a disabled fieldset appear disabled but the user can still interact with them. See IE bug #817488.

Fired at the Window when the page's entry in the session history stops being the current entry. Includes the pageshow and pagehide events.
Firefox
Firefox & Chrome also support the drawfocus ring.
Firefox & Edge do not support :after and :before for input fields
Firefox & Edge specifically only support the -webkit-text-stroke property (not using -moz- or -ms- prefix)
Firefox <40 is not completely conforming to the specs and does not respect the <base> tag for relative URIs in fetch requests. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1161625
Firefox <48 does not support calc() inside the line-height, stroke-width, stroke-dashoffset, and stroke-dasharray properties. Bug report
Firefox (9 and previous?) is buggy with min-width media queries not being recognized, but the rules inside those being parsed and used.
Firefox (prior to version 37) and Safari do not support IndexedDB inside web workers.
Firefox 10+, Chrome 26+ and Opera 11.6+ also support the new "to (side)" syntax.
Firefox 10+, Opera 11.6+, Chrome 26+ and IE10+ also support the new "to (side)" syntax.
Firefox 14 and under do not have DataView yet.
Firefox 18 and below supported the :-moz-placeholder pseudo-class rather than the ::-moz-placeholder pseudo-element.
Firefox 2 does not support inline-table
Firefox 3.5 and 3.6 partial support refers to only including support for the progress event.
Firefox 31-34 is missing the plugin-types, child-src, frame-ancestors, base-uri, and form-action directives.
Firefox 35 is missing the plugin-types, child-src, frame-ancestors, and form-action directives.
Firefox 36-44 is missing the plugin-types and child-src directives.
Firefox 37 and lower cannot host a WebSocket within a WebWorker context
Firefox 37- ignores the descriptor and the at-rule is then applied to the whole range of code points.
Firefox 38 on Android is missing the child-src directive.
Firefox 39 did not support 'crossorigin' attribute and preconnects were not processed by the preload parser. Both of these features were enabled in Firefox 41.
Firefox 39 in Mac OSX by default does not prevent alpha characters input and Firefox 42 validates only but It doesn't disable alpha keys input.
Firefox 4 & 5 support a non-standard implementation to achieve the same.
Firefox 40- users can enable support with a security preference setting.
Firefox 41 and below do not support sending File/Blob objects see bug
Firefox 42 and below do not support transform-origin on SVG elements.
Firefox 45+ is missing the plugin-types directive.
Firefox 46 and below do not support the textTrack.onCueChange() event (see details).
Firefox 51 and below does not support Flexbox in button elements. Fixed in version 52.
Firefox 52 and below do not support EventSource in web/shared workers

Firefox 52 and below had a permission dialog with an additional "not now" option. This option postponed the permission decision until later and therefore deliberately did not call any callbacks, see bug
Firefox 52+ removed access to this API due to privacy concerns.
Firefox 58 & below, Chrome 63 & below and Safari 7 & below do not appear to support sticky table headers.
Firefox requires the served mime-type to be 'image/svg+xml'.
Firefox has a bug where autofocus doesn't always scroll to the correct part of the page.
Firefox has no plans to support HTML imports though for now it can be enabled through the "dom.webcomponents.enabled" preference in about:config
Firefox Implementation Ticket
Firefox OS is reported to have partial support for this property as x-inputmode.
Firefox also has support for unofficial features.
Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-outline-radius property that acts similar to border-radius.
Firefox and Chrome do not support columns on the <fieldset> element see bug
Firefox appears to incorrectly cut off the top & bottom of a ::first-letter character in certain cases see Firefox bug #1233271
Firefox before 16 supports only dpi unit, but you can set 2dppx per min--moz-device-pixel-ratio: 2
Firefox blog post
Firefox bug
Firefox bug #1253615
Firefox bug #1291515: disable `<style></style>
Firefox bug #546052: Implement cross-fade()
Firefox bug #856337: Implement image-rendering: pixelated
Firefox currently has a media.webspeech.recognition.enable flag in about:config for this, but actual support is waiting for permissions to be sorted out.
Firefox currently lacks support for the ::cue pseudo-element. See bug #865395.
Firefox currently supports the -moz-available property rather than -moz-stretch.
Firefox does not allow-popups in versions below 28.
Firefox does not appear to support the local value when applied on a textarea element.
Firefox does not split tables into columns
Firefox does not support calc() on color functions. Example: color: hsl(calc(60 * 2), 100%, 50%). Bug Report
Firefox does not support min-height on table elements or elements with display: table
Firefox does not support width: calc() on table cells. Bug Report
Firefox does not support notifications sent immediately after one another.
Firefox does not support the break-before, break-after and break-inside properties. See the bug.
Firefox does not support the height/min-height/max-height properties, only width. See test case, Firefox bug.
Firefox doesn't support autocomplete content via datalist elements.
Firefox extension allowing support in Win7
Firefox feature request bug
Firefox feature request: Mozilla bug #1178765
Firefox feature request: Mozilla bug #1191043
Firefox for Android implementation bug
Firefox for Android tracking bug
Firefox has had a bug with position: relative in table cells, which was fixed in version 37.
Firefox implementation
Firefox implementation bug
Firefox implemention ticket
Firefox implements something similar with a different name -moz-osx-font-smoothing and different values: auto, inherit, unset, grayscale.
Firefox is not able to stretch svg images across an element - bug report.
Firefox notifications disappear after a few seconds
Firefox on OSX has a bug where content may turn entirely black
Firefox on Windows incorrectly renders plugin content within no-op 3D transforms.
Firefox only supports same-origin download links.
Firefox support bug
Firefox support bug (WONTFIX)
Firefox support is disabled by default and only supports mouse input. On Windows only, touch can be enabled with the layers.async-pan-zoom.enabled and dom.w3c_touch_events.enabled flags
Firefox supports H.264 on Windows 7 and later since version 21. Firefox supports H.264 on Linux since version 26 if the appropriate gstreamer plug-ins are installed.

Firefox supports any kind of DOM elements for .setDragImage. Chrome must have either an HTMLImageElement or any kind of DOM elements attached to the DOM and within the viewport of the browser for .setDragImage.
Firefox tracking bug
Firefox tracking bug: Implement Custom Elements (from Web Components)
Firefox tracking bug: Implement HTML Imports
Firefox up to and including 52 did not support <length> values
Firefox versions < 25 support an alternative, deprecated audio API.
Firefox versions before 57 also supported the padding-box value for box-sizing, though this value was been removed from the specification and later versions of the browser.
Firefox, Chrome and Safari support the unofficial -webkit-background-clip: text (only with prefix)
Firefox, starting with version 28, provides the 'dom.w3c_pointer_events.enabled' flag to support this specification.
Firefox/Mac, Safari/Mac, Chrome/Mac don't support PNG and JPG cursors (tested with 48px cursors).
Flexbox CSS generator
Flexbox playground and code generator
Flexbugs: Repo for flexbox bugs
Font unicode-range subsetting

For Blink/WebKit browsers: If a page already includes an SVG fragment referred to inside <img> on a page it may also work correctly for elements with a CSS background-image set with the same URL. Because of this, caniuse for a period of time considered these browsers to have full support.
For Gecko versions < 32, some browsers incorrectly report 'yes' for both "Tell sites I don't want to be tracked" _and_ "Tell sites I _do_ want to be tracked.".
For Opera the Linux version may be able to play it when the GStreamer module is up to date and the served mime-type is 'audio/ogg'.
For content to appear in pseudo-elements, the content property must be set (but may be an empty string).
For screen readers, IE, Chrome & Firefox support the accessible canvas element sub-DOM.
For support information for just :nth-child() see CSS3 selector support
For support of styling the actual placeholder text itself, see CSS ::placeholder
For the ID syntax, Chrome, Opera, and (older) Safari require the ID to be set on a view element.
For the IE11 WebView, the SVG won't work if it includes the XML declaration at the beginning.
Form attribute
Form field allowing the user to select a color.
Form field type for numbers.
Form field type that allows the user to select a value using a slider widget.

Form field widgets to easily allow users to enter a date, time or both, generally by using a calendar/time input widget. Refers to supporting the following input types: date, time, datetime-local, month & week.
Form validation
Format for marking up text captions for multimedia resources.
Free lossy video compression format.

From Gecko 2.0 (Firefox 4.0) to Gecko 14.0 (Firefox 14.0) included, Gecko supported an older syntax, slightly different from the modern one: https://hacks.mozilla.org/2010/11/firefox-4-font-feature-support/
Full Screen API

Full support for the ECMAScript 5 specification. Features include Function.prototype.bind, Array methods like indexOf, forEach, map & filter, Object methods like defineProperty, create & keys, the trim method on Strings and many more.
Function shorthand using => syntax and lexical this binding.
Functions for measuring performance
Gamepad API

General information about Responsive Images

GitHub repository

Given coordinates for a point relative to the viewport, returns the element that a click event would be dispatched at if the user were to click the point (in other words, the element that hit-testing would find).

Gives a hint to the browser to begin the connection handshake (DNS, TCP, TLS) in the background to improve performance. This is indicated using <link rel="preconnect" href="https://example-domain.com/">
Gives a hint to the browser to lower the loading priority of a resource.
Gives a hint to the browser to perform a DNS lookup in the background to improve performance. This is indicated using <link rel="dns-prefetch" href="http://example-domain.com/">
Gives a hint to the browser to render the specified page in the background, speeding up page load if the user navigates to it. This is indicated using <link rel="prerender" href="(url)">

Has "previous" and "next" virtual keyboard buttons that follow tabindex order.
Has a bug where border-image incorrectly overrides border-style. See test case, WebKit bug, discussion
Has non-standard key identifiers and incorrect behaviour with AltGraph.

IE
IE & Edge are reported to not support calc inside a 'flex'. (Not tested on older versions)
IE < 10 may interleave execution of scripts, See the discussion.
IE 10 Mobile does not always provide crisp SVG backgrounds, particularly when zooming in.
IE 10 canvas doesn't support setLineDash or lineDashOffsetsee bug
IE 10 does not properly handle the appcache FALLBACK section. It only handles subresources if they are already in the cache.
IE 10 has a bug where text-shadow doesn't work when used inside columns see testcase
IE 10+ supports a fourth length value for the shadow's "spread". This is not (yet) part of the specification.
IE 11 lost the support for non-RGB/a PNG format images inside FavIcon.ico, does work in IE 10.
IE 11 added support in an update on June 9, 2015
IE 11 and Edge 16- use window.doNotTrack instead of navigator.doNotTrack.
IE 11 does not allow scrolling when document.documentElement is set to full screen.
IE 11 does not properly support fullscreen when opening from an iframe.
IE 11 does not vertically align items correctly when min-height is used see bug
IE 11 doesn't allow going to fullscreen mode when the event that triggers msRequestFullscreen() is a keydown or pointerdown event (keypress and click do work)
IE 11 requires a unit to be added to the third argument, the flex-basis property see MSFT documentation
IE 8 and 9 store data based only on hostname, ignoring the scheme (http vs https) and port number as required by the specification.
IE 8 has a resize issue with display-inline block.
IE 8 ignores box-sizing: border-box if min/max-width/height is used.
IE 9 & IE 10 do not support rem units when used in the font shorthand property (the entire declaration is ignored) or when used on pseudo elements.
IE 9 - 11 and Edge do not support width: calc() on table cells. Bug Report
IE 9 - 11 don't render box-shadow when calc() is used for any of the values
IE 9 and 10 are vendor-prefixed as navigator.msDoNotTrack
IE 9 and 10 return true on 'pointerEvents' in document.documentElement.style due to support on SVG elements, but they don't support it on HTML elements.
IE 9, 10 and 11 do not support rem units when used in the "line-height" property when used on :before and :after pseudo elements (https://connect.microsoft.com/IE/feedback/details/776744).
IE Blog post
IE Mobile
IE Web Platform Status and Roadmap: Custom Elements
IE Web Platform Status and Roadmap: HTML Imports
IE and Edge < 14 do not fire the popstate event when the URL's hash value changes. See MS bug report.
IE and Edge do not support applying SVG filter effects to HTML elements using CSS. Bug Report
IE and Edge does not support globalAlpha for drawImage of SVG graphics. see bugsee testcase
IE and Edge only supports cursors in the CUR format.
IE and Edge truncate all units to 2 decimals places. Lengths coming from fractions may not be rendered with the expected value.
IE and Firefox do not appear to have support for nested ruby structures see testcase
IE demo page with information

IE does not convert the value to an invariant culture. IE simply submits the value as it was typed, using the user's regional settings, but the spec says the browser should submit in a normalized way.
IE does not recognize the :disabled pseudo-class selector for <fieldset disabled>
IE does not support Data URIs as cursor values
IE has been reported to incorrectly break on elements across columns when having more than 3 columns.
IE ignores the unicode-range if the U is lowercase e.g 'u+0061'.
IE implements a different API than the one from WHATWG.
IE only supports the 'width' and 'height' properties.
IE platform status (SVG)

IE supports the ch unit, but unlike other browsers its width is that specifically of the "0" glyph, not its surrounding space. As a result, 3ch for example is shorter than the width of the string "000" in IE.
IE<=8 instead only supports the proprietary .attachEvent() method. It also does not support the capture phase of DOM event dispatch; it only supports event bubbling.
IE, Firefox and later Chrome versions implement the same origin policy, so any font library served on a different domain from the page will not be downloaded unless using CORS.
IE10 & 11 fire the "change" event instead of "input" on mousemove.
IE10 & 11 have some bugs related to the step value.
IE10 & IE11 are reported to not support transitioning the column-count property.
IE10 (and IE 10&11 mobile) does not support Uint8ClampedArray
IE10 : The storage event is fired even on the originating document where it occurred. Causes problems with multiple windows websites, and huge problems with iframes.
IE10 and 11 have a problem validating number fields in combination with the step attribute and certain values
IE10 and 11 do not always appear to support the ss01 value correctly.
IE10 and 11 do not support synchronous requests, with support being phased out in other browsers too. This is due to detrimental effects resulting from making them.
IE10 and 11 on Windows 7 can hide the text under certain circumstances.
IE10 and IE11 also have broken .valueAsNumber results that don't follow the spec, e.g. for
IE10 and IE11 do not appear to support overriding min-width or max-width values using the initial value.
IE10 and IE11 do not support CSS keyframe blocks inside media queries. Must be defined outside of media query definitions. example
IE10 and IE11 on Windows 7 have a bug where translate transform values are always interpreted as pixels when used in animations test case
IE10 and IE11 will not fire Animation events for pseudo element animations. See example here
IE10 crashes when a div with a property using calc() has a child with same property with inherit.
IE10 developer guide info
IE10 doesn't seem to render rgba(255,255,255,0.25) properly. It seems to ignore the alpha value and uses 100% white instead.
IE10 in Windows 8 has an issue where localStorage can fail with the error message "SCRIPT5: Access is denied" if "integrity" settings are not set correctly. see details
IE10+ & Edge have an issue with currentColor in a linear gradient see bug
IE10+ does not make a CORS request if port is the only difference (IE Bug #781303)
IE10+ does not send cookies when withCredential=true (IE Bug #759587). A workaround is to use a P3P policy
IE10+ has already supported these property which are not in standard at present such as double-tap-zoom, cross-slide-x, cross-slide-y.
IE10, IE11, and Edge < 14 don't support using calc() inside a transform. Bug report
IE11 : The storage event's oldValue and newValue are identical (newValue is supposed to contain the storage's updated value).
IE11 does not support CSS transitions on the SVG fill property.
IE11 and below do not support <foreignObject>.
IE11 does not appear to support CORS for images in the canvas element
IE11 does not include the child nodes when they are removed by setting the innerHTMLsee bug.
IE11 does not properly synchronize localStorage between different windows. see bug
IE11 does not support transitioning values set with calc()
IE11 has issues with last-of-type with custom elements
IE11 is reported to have trouble with calc() with nested expressions, e.g. width: calc((100% - 10px) / 3); (i.e. it rounds differently)
IE11 is reported to not support calc() correctly in generated content
IE6 does not properly support combinations of pseudo classes like :link, :active and :visited
IE6 does support full transparency in 8-bit PNGs, which can sometimes be an alternative to 24-bit PNGs.
IE7 & 8 do not support PNG's alpha transparency when you apply CSS alpha filter on them or a parent element.
IE7 and IE8 support only these CSS3 selectors: General siblings (element1~element2) and Attribute selectors [attr^=val], [attr$=val], and [attr*=val]
IE7 does not support inherit as a value on any of these properties.
IE7 doesn't support min-width on input button/submit button/reset button.
IE7 doesn't support all pseudo classes (like :focus) or pseudo elements (like :before and :after)
IE8 Security Part VII: ClickJacking Defenses - IEBlog
IE8 has some bugs with max-width/height combined with overflow: auto/scroll.
IE8 has virtually no ES5 support, but does support Object.defineProperty, Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor, JSON parsing & Property access on strings
IE8 only supports the online/offline events on document.body, rather than window.
IE8 only supports the single-colon CSS 2.1 syntax (i.e. :pseudo-class). It does not support the double-colon CSS3 syntax (i.e. ::pseudo-element).
IE8 only supports the single-colon CSS 2.1 syntax (i.e. :first-line). It does not support the double-colon CSS3 syntax (i.e. ::first-line).
IE8's events are triggered synchronously, which may lead to to unexpected results.
IE8-11 does not update an element's :hover status when scrolling without moving the pointer.
IE9 supported dns-prefetch as prefetch as the former wasn’t defined yet.
IE9 appears to have some issues in correctly determining longitude/latitude.
IE9 does not appear to render "background-repeat: round" correctly.
IE9 does not calculate viewport units correctly when the browser or OS is zoomed.

IE9 does not correctly render multiple backgrounds for TableRows. Attempting to do a left-cap, right cap, and repeated fill on a row results in the left cap and fill being correct, but the right cap will display at the end of the first column, then again part way through the rest of the table.
IE9 doesn't support multiple backgrounds with gradient and image in one rule.
IE9 will subtract the width of the scrollbar to the width of the element when set to position: absolute / fixed , overflow: auto / overflow-y: scroll
IE9+ supports properties of an older version of the CSS Ruby specification.
IE9, IE10, IE11 ignore CSS rem units in the line-height property. Bug report.
IE9-11 desktop & mobile don't properly scale SVG files. Adding height, width, viewBox, and CSS rules seem to be the best workaround.
IE9-Edge12, Safari 5.1-6, and UCWeb 11 do not support referencing external files via <use xlink:href>. Polyfills are available: server-side inlining + snippet - script
IE9-IE11 fail to call the "reviver" argument recursively (in some versions of windows). see discussion
IE9-IE11 supports :empty but will not repaint/relayout the page if content is added/removed from an :empty selected element
Icon used by browsers to identify a webpage or site. While all browsers support the .ico format, the PNG format can be preferable.
Icon used by browsers to identify a webpage or site. While all browsers support the .ico format, the SVG format can be preferable to more easily support higher resolutions or larger icons.

If a font has multiple types of variations based on the width of characters, the font-stretch property allows the appropriate one to be selected. The property in itself does not cause the browser to stretch to a font.

If a temporal or number <input> has max and/or min attributes, then :in-range matches when the value is within the specified range and :out-of-range matches when the value is outside the specified range. If there are no range constraints, then neither pseudo-class matches.
If both ICO and PNG are available, will ALWAYS use ICO file, regardless of sizes set.
If both ICO and PNG are available, will use ICO over PNG if ICO has better matching sizes set.
If multiple formats are available, will use the last one loaded, regardless of sizes (effectively picks at random).
If the element is fully within the visible area of the viewport, it does nothing. Otherwise, the element is scrolled into view. A proprietary variant of the standard Element.scrollIntoView() method.

If the run-in box contains a block box, same as block. If a block box follows the run-in box, the run-in box becomes the first inline box of the block box. If an inline box follows, the run-in box becomes a block box.
If the viewport size is set using a <meta> element, the -ms-text-size-adjust property is ignored. See MSDN
Ignores the autoplay attribute by default, though autoplay behavior can be enabled by users
Image format that supports lossy and lossless compression, as well as animation and alpha transparency.
Image function to create a "crossfade" between images. This allows one image to transition (fade) into another based on a percentage value.
Implementation Status
Implementation for Internet Explorer
Implementation of Pointer Events in IE10
Implemented old Web Intents
Implementing Native Drag and Drop
Implements an outdated version of the spec.
Implements an earlier prefixed syntax as -webkit-gradient
Improved support for high-resolution displays with the srcset image attribute
Improvements to Indexed DB, including getAll(), renaming stores and indexes, and binary keys.
Improving scroll performance with passive event listeners - Google Developers Updates
In Android 4.0-4.3 position:fixed inside an iframe will cause unexpected behviour.

In Chrome (tested in 45) inputs marked as disabled or hidden while also marked as required are incorrectly being considered for constraint validation. https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/forms.html#concept-fe-disabled
In Chrome (up to 43.0), for transition-delay property, either explicitly specified or written within transition property, the unit cannot be ommitted even if the value is 0.
In Chrome 38 desktop the visibilitychange event is fired twice Chrome bug
In Chrome 51 ~ 56, PSL matched credentials are not supported. This means you cannot use credentials set on a.example.com in b.example.com. This is supported since Chrome 57.
In Chrome animation-fill-mode backwards is wrong if steps(x, start) is used see example.
In Chrome the API is enabled on Android only, support for other platforms is coming . Support is also available on Firefox OS.
In Chrome the API is only usable over secure connections. (corresponding bug)

In Chrome, DataTransfer.addElement is not implemented. There is no other way to implement a draggable object, that updates during the drag due to some other circumstances (e.g. changes color on a valid drop spot), as it is just a static image if addElement is not supported.

In Chrome, when using the common inherit box-sizing fix (https://www.paulirish.com/2012/box-sizing-border-box-ftw/) in combination with a <details> element, the children of the <details> element get rendered as if they were box-sizing: content-box;. See: https://codepen.io/jochemnabuurs/pen/yYzYqM
In Edge 15 animations with css variables may cause the webpage to crash see bug
In Edge 15 is not possible to use css variables in pseudo elements see bug
In Edge 15, nested calculations with css variables are not computed and are ignored see bug
In Edge filter won't apply if the element or it's parent has negative z-index. See bug.
In Firefox < 4, usage limited to the background and background-image CSS properties
In Firefox prior to version 36 server-sent events do not reconnect automatically in case of a connection interrupt (bug)
In Firefox there is a documented bug where 100vh has no effect on any element with its display property set to table.
In Firefox when clicking on contenteditable nested into draggable, cursor is always positioned to the start of editable text. Still not fixed in version 18.0.1.
In Firefox, an element won't drag unless the dragstart handler sets dataTransfer data (even if it doesn't get retrieved). Test case
In Firefox, captions are not visible for audio-only files in the video tag (see bug).
In Firefox, the "privacy.reduceTimerPrecision" preference is enabled by default and defaults to 20us in Firefox 59; in 60 it will be 2ms.
In Firefox, the "privacy.resistFingerprinting" preference changes the precision to 100ms or the value of "privacy.resistFingerprinting.reduceTimerPrecision.microseconds", whichever is larger.
In Firefox, the dragging near the edge of scrollable regions does not cause scrolling
In Firefox, the dragstart event does not fire on button elements. This effectively disables drag and drop for button elements.
In Firefox, the property column-span (or -moz-column-span) does not yet work. See the bug.
In IE 10 and 11, using vw units with 3D transforms causes unexpected behavior
In IE 11 canvas.toDataURL() does not work if the canvas has images with data URI sources see bug
In IE attempting to access localStorage on HTML files served from the file system results in the localStorage object being undefined
In IE<=11, calling getBoundingClientRect on an element outside of the DOM throws an unspecified error instead of returning a 0x0 DOMRect. See IE bug #829392.
In IE10 adjacent sibling selector doesn't work with pseudo-class in case of E:active F.

In IE10 and IE11, containers with display: flex and flex-direction: column will not properly calculate their flexed childrens' sizes if the container has min-height but no explicit height property. See bug.

In IE10 and IE11, when using innerText (and also innerHTML or outerHTML) on a textarea which has a placeholder attribute, the returned HTML/text also uses the placeholder's value as the actual textarea's value. See bug.

In IE10 and IE11, when using innerText, innerHTML or outerHTML on a textarea which has a placeholder attribute, the returned HTML/text also uses the placeholder's value as the actual textarea's value. See bug.
In IE10 the default value for flex is 0 0 auto rather than 0 1 auto as defined in the latest spec.
In IE8, the min-width property applies to content-box even if box-sizing is set to border-box.
In IE9 inside an iframe, viewport units will be calculated in the context of the parent window and not the iframe.
In IE9 the caret of a textarea disappears when you use translate.
In IE9-10 draggable attribute could be effectively applied for link and image elements. For div and span elements you should call 'element.dragDrop()' to start drag event.

In Internet Explorer contenteditable cannot be applied to the TABLE, COL, COLGROUP, TBODY, TD, TFOOT, TH, THEAD, and TR elements directly, a content editable SPAN, or DIV element can be placed inside the individual table cells (See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/ms533690(v=vs.85).aspx).
In Internet Explorer the timeout property may only be set after calling open and before calling send.
In Internet Explorer, the start and end values are not supported.
In Opera 12.1 & below ValidityState.tooLong is true when the input's initial value exceeds the maxlength. Per the spec, it should instead be false until the user edits the value.

In Safari 10.1 and below, the height of (non flex) children are not recognized in percentages. However other browsers recognize and scale the children based on percentage heights. Fixed in all versions > 10.1 (See bug) The bug also appeared in Chrome but was fixed in Chrome 51
In Safari 8, after setting event.dataTransfer.dropEffect, the value in the drop event is always 'none'
In Safari ::selection styles do not work in combination with CSS multi-column.
In Windows 7, the maximum supported resolution is 1920 × 1088 pixels for both software and DXVA decoding. MSDN).
In browsers that don't support these events, one alternative is to use a capture phase event listener for the focus and/or blur events.
In iOS 5 & 6 localStorage data is stored in a location that may occasionally be cleared out by the OS.
In private browsing mode, Safari and iOS Safari up to including version 10.x as well as the Android browser (not include Chrome for Android) do not support setting sessionStorage or localStorage.
In versions before Safari 6, Typed Arrays are much slower than normal arrays.
In webkit-based browsers first character of text inside elements, styled with ::first-letter, is not highlighted while selecting the text. See bug
Includes support for ArrayBuffer objects.

Including an i before the ] in a CSS attribute selector causes the attribute value to be matched in an ASCII-case-insensitive manner. For example, [b="xyz" i] would match both <a b="xyz"> and <a b="XYZ">.
Incorrectly treats none as contain see MDN and Edge 18 changelog
Indeterminacy does not affect a checkbox's checkedness state. It merely affects how the checkbox is displayed.

Indeterminate checkboxes are displayed in a state which is distinct both from being checked or being unchecked. They are commonly used in hierarchical checkboxes to indicate that only some of the checkbox's descendants are checked.

Informs the browsers that a given resource should be prefetched so it can be loaded more quickly. This is indicated using <link rel="prefetch" href="(url)">
Initial Letter

Inline SVG in HTML works in Android 4+, but is reported to have bugs when manipulating the elements using JS, e.g. setting className does not work. Using getAttribute('class') and setAttribute('class', 'foobar') works.
Inline SVG in HTML5
Input Method Editor API
Input attribute specification

Input elements can sometimes show placeholder text as a hint to the user on what to type in. See, for example, the placeholder attribute in HTML5. The :placeholder-shown pseudo-class matches an input element that is showing such placeholder text.
Inserts a string of HTML into a specified position in the DOM relative to the given element.
Instructions on enabling WebGL
Interaction Media Features and their potential (for incorrect assumptions)
Intermittently displays distorted images due to bug present (see known issues)
Internationalization API
Internet Explorer 10 and 11 accidentally show placeholder attributes on textareas as their actual value when using innerHTML, etc.
Internet Explorer 10 and 11 do not show the placeholder when the field is focused, even if the field is empty.
Internet Explorer 10 and 11 fire the input event when an input field with a placeholder is focused or on page load when the placeholder contains certain characters, like Chinese.
Internet Explorer 10 and 11 fire the input event when an input field with a placeholder is focused or on page load when the placeholder contains certain characters, like Chinese.

Internet Explorer 8 and 9, and Firefox versions 6.0 and below only support strings as postMessage's message. References: https://dev.opera.com/articles/view/window-postmessage-messagechannel/#crossdoc, https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/DOM/window.postMessage
Internet Explorer 9 in print-mode interprets vh as pages. 30vh = 30 pages
Internet Explorer accomplishes support using the non-standard declaration -ms-interpolation-mode: nearest-neighbor
Internet Explorer does not support storing most of the ASCII characters with codes under x20.
Internet Explorer does not support the oldURL/newURL attributes. WindowEventHandlers.onhashchange
Internet Explorer does not support transitions of the 'background-size' property.
Internet Explorer implements Pointer Events specification which supports more input devices than Touch Events one.
Internet Explorer supports different values from an earlier version of the spec, which originated from SVG.
Internet Explorer supports the W3C proposal HTML+TIME, which is largely the same as XHTML+SMIL
Internet Explorer will display a security prompt for access to the OS clipboard.
Internet Explorer's gesture and touch implementation.
IntersectionObserver
IntersectionObserver does not trigger its callback in a Chrome background tab

JPEG 2000 (JP2) was created by the Joint Photographic Experts Group committee in 2000 with the intention of superseding their original discrete cosine transform-based JPEG standard (created in 1992) with a newly designed, wavelet-based method. It offers some advantages in image fidelity over standard JPEG.

JavaScript API for performing basic cryptographic operations in web applications
JavaScript API to interact with Universal Second Factor (U2F) devices. This allows users to log into sites more securely using two-factor authentication with a USB dongle.

JavaScript event that fires when the DOM is loaded, but before all page assets are loaded (CSS, images, etc.).

JavaScript typed arrays provide a mechanism for accessing raw binary data much more efficiently. Includes: Int8Array, Uint8Array, Uint8ClampedArray, Int16Array, Uint16Array, Int32Array, Uint32Array, Float32Array & Float64Array
Keeps elements positioned as "fixed" or "relative" depending on how it appears in the viewport. As a result the element is "stuck" when necessary while scrolling.

Lack of support in mobile browsers may be due to the OS file picker not having support for selecting a directory.
Latest fragmentation specification (includes column & region breaks)
Length units representing a percentage of the current viewport dimensions: width (vw), height (vh), the smaller of the two (vmin), or the larger of the two (vmax).
Lets you create animations that are run in the browser and as well as inspect and manipulate animations created through declarative means like CSS.

Like #1 but also supports *-before and *-end for *-block-start and *-block-end properties as well as start and end values for text-align
Like animated GIFs, but allowing 24-bit colors and alpha transparency

Links with rel="noreferrer" set do not send the request's "referrer" header. This prevents the destination site from seeing what URL the user came from.

Loading JavaScript module scripts using <script type="module"> Includes support for the nomodule attribute.

Locale-sensitive collation (string comparison), number formatting, and date and time formatting.
Log output on Firefox for Android can be accessed using WebIDE
Log output on iOS 6+ Safari can only be seen by connecting to a Mac and using the Safari debugger.
Log output on older Android browsers can be retrieved via Android's logcat command or using Chrome Developer Tools in Android 4.4+/Chrome for Android see details

Low-level syntax available in font-feature-settings property equivalent to OpenType features: salt, ss01 through ss20, cv01 through cv99, swsh, cswh, ornm, nalt
